Speaker: philips
Dialogue: You're looking well, Dutch.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: It's been a long time, General.

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: We've got a real problem here, something right up your alley.

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: Eighteen hours ago I was informed that one of our choppers, transporting three presidential cabinet members from this charming little country, was shot down...  Here.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: That's over the border, General.

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: We're certain they've been captured by the guerrillas.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What have you got in mind, General.

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: We figure we've got less than twenty-four hours to catch up with them.  After that, there's not much hope.  We want a rescue operation mounted tonight.  That doesn't give you much time.

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: You lift off in three hours.  There's one other thing.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What's that, General?

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: Someone else will be going in with you.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You know we don't work with outsiders, General.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Who said anything about outsiders, Dutch?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Last time we danced, it was Lieutenant, Schaefer.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Dillon, you son of a bitch.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: How you been, Dutch?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You've been pushing too many Pencils, Dillon.  Had enough?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: No way, old buddy.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You never did know when to quit.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: That piece of work you guys pulled off at the Berlin embassy last week was really something.  Blew the entry points on three floors and neutralized the opposition in eight seconds flat. Beautiful.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Like the old days, Dillon.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Also heard that you passed on that little job in Libya.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Wasn't my style.  We're a rescue unit, not assassins.  This must be good.  Big shot from the CIA, leaves his desk to come back to the bush. What's so important?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: The set-up is simple, Dutch. One day job.  We pick up their trail at the chopper, run 'em down, grab the hostages and bounce back across the border before anyone knows we were there.  You've done it a hundred times.  Nothing out of the ordinary.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: And nothing we can't handle alone.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Not to worry, Dutch.  I haven't lost my edge.  They've got a head start on us in some real tough country, otherwise, believe me, it's a piece of cake.

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: Gentlemen, we're losing time.  Good luck, Major.

Speaker: pilot one
Dialogue: Redbird Two, Two.  Bearing south, three, five, zero, one o'ckock on the saddle ridge. Over.

Speaker: pilot two
Dialogue: Roger, Blue Leader.  Three, five, zero, on your move. Over.

Speaker: hawkins
Dialogue: Hey, Billy, how many marines does it take to eat a squirrel?

Speaker: hawkins
Dialogue: Two.  One to eat it and one to watch for cars.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Get that stinkin' thing out of my face, Blain!

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: ...bunch of slack-jawed faggots around here...  ...make you a God-damned sexual ty-ran-toe-sore-ass... just like me.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Our rendezvous points and radio freqs. are indicated and fixed.  AWACS contact on four hour intervals.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Who's our back-up on this?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: No such thing, old buddy. It's a one way ticket. Once we cross that border, we're on our own.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: This gets better by the minute.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Man, that's a real bad habit you've got.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: You don't know how much I missed this, Dutch!!!  Once you get this in your blood, you never get it out!!!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You never were all that smart...let's go!!!

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: The pilots have each got one round in the head.  And whoever hit it stripped the shit out of it.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Took 'em out with a heat seeker.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Mmmnnn...?

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: I don't think that was any ordinary army taxi...

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: ...looks more like a surveillance bird to me.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Billy's on it.  Heat seeker.  Pretty sophisticated for half-asses mountain boys.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: They're getting better equipped every day.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Major, looks like there were ten, maybe twelve guerrillas.  Looks like they took some prisoners from the chopper.  Then a different set of track, over there.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Six others, U.S. issue jungle boots.  They came in from the north, then followed the guerrillas.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Mean anything to you?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Probably another rebel patrol. They operate in here all the time.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Get ahead, see what you can find.  Slow and easy.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: J.S. Davis, Captain, U.S. Army...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: I knew this man.  Green Berets, out of Fort Bragg.  What the hell were they doing in here?  You got any answers for this, Dillon?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Uh...I wasn't told of any operations in this area.  They shouldn't have been here.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Well somebody sent them.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Must have run into the guerrillas ...Fucking animals.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Time to let 'ol 'painless' out of the bag.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What happened here, Billy?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Strange, Major.  There was a firefight.  Shooting in all directions.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: I can't believe Jim Hopper walked into an ambush.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I don't believe he did, Sir. I couldn't find a single track. Just doesn't make sense.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What about the rest of Hopper's men?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: It's like they just disappeared.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Stick with the guerilla trail.  Let's get it over with.  We move. Five meter spread.  No sound. Nothing.

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: Payback time.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Got it?

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: Say, Bull.  What's goin' down? We got movement?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: No.  Shithead with his trenchcoat and dee-coda-da ring was makin' enough noise to get us all waxed.  I don't like that guy.  Don't like him at my back.  I ain't winding up like those bastards back there.

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: I know what you mean, Bull, but don't sweat it, me and 'ol 'painless' here are watchin' the front door.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: As always, bro...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Just killed one of the                             * prisoners.  No time for                            * invitations.  We take them, now.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Ready, kid?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: On your nine!!!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Stick around.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Down!!!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Hawk, Get Con. Op. on the hook!  Position and situation, now!

Speaker: hawkins
Dialogue: You got it, Major!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Any sign of the hostages?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Another thing, Major, we were lucky...couple of those guys we waxed are Russians, military advisors by the look of it.  Something big was about to happen here.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Good work, Mac.  Clear the area, no traces.  Get the men ready to move.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Shit...

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: You're hit.  You're bleedin', man.

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: Ain't got time to bleed.

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: Son of a bitch's dug in like a Alabama tick...  ...jack us around all day.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Hell, dude, we don't have all day.

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: Shit, Pancho!!!

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: What's your problem, dude?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: This is beautiful!  More than we ever thought.  We got the bastards!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: I think this is the one you want.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: We've averted a major guerrilla invasion, Dutch...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: It was all bullshit.  All of it. From the start...you set us up, got us in here to do your dirty work.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: That's right, I set you up. You're a veteran at this, Dutch, I had to.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Why us?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Because I told you, you're the best.  I knew you could do it but I couldn't get you in here without a cover story.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What story did you give to Davis?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: We've been lookin' for this place for months.  The chopper must have gotten close when they got shot down.  Hopper                        * was sent in to get my men. He was just doing his job. When he disappeared I had to clean this up,  I had to stop there bastards.  We were so close, we couldn't quit.  We couldn't sleep through this one.  I needed you, Dutch, can't you see that?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: To invade a foreign country, illegally?  You lied, Dillon. Stacked the odds against us.  Set us up.  You could have gotten us all killed.  You used to be one of us, Dillon, someone I could trust with my life...

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: We've been through a lot together Dutch.  When we were together, no                  * one could stop us, the hottest                     * Goddamned team the army ever saw.                  * But things changed, I woke up. We're fighting them in a dozen Goddamned countries.  It's a fight we can't lose, Dutch.  We're all expendable assets, can't you see that?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: That's your problem, Dillon. You always did put ambition before the lives of your men.  This is your dirty little war, not mine.

Speaker: hawkins
Dialogue: Major!

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Are you all right?

Speaker: hawkins
Dialogue: Major, we stepped into some real shit here.  I got a hook-up with aerial surveillance.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Movement?

Speaker: hawkins
Dialogue: Guerrillas swarming like flies                     * all over the place.  Can't be more                 * then one, maybe two miles away.                    * Place is going down, Major.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: How much time?

Speaker: hawkins
Dialogue: Half an hour, maybe less.                          *

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Tell Mac we move in five.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: She goes with us.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: She's too valuable.  She's got to know their whole network.  The whole set up. We take her with us.                               *

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: We take her and she'll give away our position, every chance she gets.  No prisoners, Dillon.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: You're still under orders, Dutch.  You want to make the call, or should I?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: I'm getting my men out of this damn jungle, Dillon.  She's your baggage.  You fall behind, you're on your own.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: This place is too hot for a pick-up. They won't touch us until we're over the border.  We can lift at LZ 49, here.  Except for this valley.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Looks bad, Major.  It's gonna be a real bitch.  If we follow above the river and then down, here, at this canyon, we might find a way out.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Not much choice.  Pancho, take the lead.  Double time it.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Lock n' load, watch your ass.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: You touch me again, pig, and I will cut off your balls!

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: It's a long walk back, make it easy on yourself.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Hey, Dillon, over here.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Dillon, over here.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Yeah, what is it, Sergeant?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: When my people catch you, you'll wish you were him.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Anytime.

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Dillon, over here.

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Dillon, over here.

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Dillon, over here.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: I've seen some badass bush before, but nothin' like this, man.  Little taste 'o home?

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: I hear you bro, this is some shit.  Makes Cambodia look like Kansas.  Lose your way in here, man, you be in some kinda hurt.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Shit.  Come on...

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Don't try it.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: You should put her on a leash, Agent Man.  If you can't handle her, just say the word.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Try that again.  Please.                           *

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Watch her.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What's got Billy so spooked?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Can't say, Major...been squirrely all mornin'... fuckin' weird...sometimes I think that nose of his is too good...smells things that ain't there.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What is it...?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Billy...What the hell's wrong with you?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Something...in the trees...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: ...there?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: It's...nothing...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What do you think...?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: It's nothing...

Speaker: hawkins
Dialogue: Please...

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Look out, behind you!!!  Hawkins spins...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: It's not her blood.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Hawkins?

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: I can't tell.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What in God's name...?

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: I think it's Hawkins.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Where the hell is his body?

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: There's no sign of it.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Ramirez, ask her what happened.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: She says...the jungle came alive, and took him...

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: That isn't what she said... she said...  ...she doesn't make sense.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Couple of sappers been trailing us all the way from the camp, Major.  Billy heard them.  She set us up, ran for it...They were waiting. I should've wasted the bitch when I had the chance.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Why didn't she escape?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: They did the same thing to Davis...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: I want him found.  Sweep pattern and double back.  Fifty meters.

Speaker: blain
Dialogue: Come on in you fuckers...come on in.  'ol 'painless' is waitin'...

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Contact, 30 Right!!!

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: I...saw it.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You saw what?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: I saw it.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: ...Just like the others...no powder burns, no shrapnel.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: The wound all fused, cauterized...what the hell did this?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: ...Mac!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Mac!  Mac!  Look at me!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Mac, who did this?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: I don't know.  Goddamn it, something...I saw something/.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Nothing.  The same thing. Not a fucking trace.  No bodies, blood, anything.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: We're losing the light.  Mac, I want a defensive position above this ridge, mined with everything we're got.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Yessir.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Put him in his poncho and liner and carry him back. We'll bury him in the morning.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: I'll take him.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: We've got most of the flares, frags. and two claymores just outside.  Nothin's comin' close to here without trippin' on somethin'.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Thank you, Sergeant.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Bull.  It's never easy.  He was a good soldier.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: The best friend I ever had.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Good-bye, Bro.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Blazer One, say again...

Speaker: blazer one
Dialogue: Red Fox, I say again.  Your request for extraction denied. Your area still compromised. Proceed to Sector 3000 for prisoner extraction, Priority Alpha.  Next contact at 1030 hours.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Roger, Blazer One.  1030 hours...damn, bastards.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: We're still too far in, they won't risk coming in for us.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Expendable assets, Dillon. Seems Langley is never around when you need them.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: I can accept that, it comes with the job.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Bullshit.  You're just like the rest of us.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Shit load o' good a chopper'd do us in here anyway.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Mac.  Who hit us today?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Don't know, only saw one of 'em.  Camouflaged.  He was there...  ...Those fucking eyes...

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: What, Sergeant?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: ...I drew down and fired right at it.  Capped-off two hundred rounds and then the Mini-gun; the full pack. Nothin'...nothin' on this earth could have lived...not at that range.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: I've got the first watch.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Ask her again.  What did she see?  What happened to Hawkins?

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: She says the same thing... It was the jungle...

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: You know something Billy, what is it?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I'm scared.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Bullshit.  You ain't afraid of no man.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: There's something out there, waiting for us...it ain't no man.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: He's losing his cool.  There's nothing out there but a couple of men that we're going to have to take down.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You still don't get it, do you Dillon?  He took Davis... and now he wants us.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: ...a real number ten night. Remember Bro?  Only you and me, the only one's out of the whole fuckin' platoon who made it out.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: ...we walked out on top of 'em.  Not a scratch, not a fuckin' scratch.  No fuckin' chili-choker got to you, Bro...you were just too good...

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: ...I promise you this, Bro... whoever he is, I hope he's plannin' to hit us again...  ...'cause he's got my name on 'em.

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Got the motherfucker...

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: A pig...just a fucking pig...

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Holy shit, Mac.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Get a field dressing on that right away.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Where's the girl?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Major, over here.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: The body...it's gone.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: Came in through the trip wires, took it right out from under our noses...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Boar set off the trip flare, Major.  No other tracks.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: How could anyone get through this, carry Blain out, right                       * under our noses without leavin'                    * a trace?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: He knows our defenses.                             * * RAMIREZ Why didn't he try to kill one of us last night?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: He came back for the body.  He's killing us, one at a time...

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Like a Hunter.                                     *

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: He uses the trees.                                 *

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Yesterday.  What did you see?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: You're wastin' your time.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: No more games.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: I don't know what it was. It...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: It changes colors, like the chameleon.  It uses the jungle...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: What's you name?

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: Anna.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Anna.  He's hunting us.  You know that?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: What the hell do you think you're doing?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: We're going to need everyone.                      *

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: What are you talking about? We'll be out of here in ten                        * minutes.                                           *

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: We're not going.                                   *

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: That rendezvous is ten maybe                       * twelve miles, at most!  We're                      * almost home.  But the chopper                      * won't wait.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Dillon...This thing doesn't                        * care who we are, who she is. We make a stand or there won't                     * be anyone left to make that                        * chopper.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: There is something else.  When the big man was killed, you must have wounded it.  It's blood was on the leaves.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: If it bleeds, we can kill it.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: * We've got to get the hell out                      * of here, now, while we've still                    * got the chance.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: He'll be looking for the trip wires. If we're lucky, he won't see this.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Now what, Dutch.  You going to send your mystery guest an invitation?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You're catching on, Dillon.

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: -- like a butcher.  The old ones in the village cross themselves and whisper crazy things.  'Demonio, cazador de trofoes...Only the hottest times of the hottest years...'  Crazy things...This year is grows hot.  And we begin finding our men.  We find them sometimes without their skin. Sometimes...much, much worse.  Cazador de trofoes...means the demon who takes trophies.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: What'll you try next -- cheese?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Satisfied?  Now let's get the hell out...

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: What is God's name...?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Mac!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Get Ramirez on his feet!  Take the girl and get the hell out of here!

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: No way, Dutch.  I'm going. You get these people and get the hell out of here.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: This isn't your style, Dillon.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Guess I've picked up some bad habits from you, Dutch.  Now don't argue with me, you know I'm right.  Get to that chopper and hold it for us. We'll be along.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You know you can't win this one.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: You know me, Dutch, I never did know when to quit.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Dillon!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: I'll see you there.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Right behind you.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: He's busted up, bad, Major.

Speaker: ramirez
Dialogue: I can make it, Major.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Come on, Poncho, we're getting out of here.  Billy, take the radio, leave the rest.  Come on!

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Come on, you motherfucker!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Dillon, over here.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Dillon, over here.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Mac?

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: Out there.  Past the rocks... can you see it?

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: We're gonna take this thing.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Take a position over there. I'll work around towards you. When I flush him, you nail him...

Speaker: mac
Dialogue: ...Right, I got a score to settle for the Bro...

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: We both got scores to settle.

Speaker: dillon
Dialogue: Mac...Mac.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Billy!!!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Billy!!!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Get back, into the rocks!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Run!  Get to the chopper!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: You couldn't see me.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: One chance, that's all.

Speaker: anna's voice
Dialogue: Look out, behind you!!!

Speaker: anna's voice
Dialogue: ...Look out, behind you!

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Anna...?

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Anna...?

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: Dillon, over here...

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Bleed, you bastard.

Speaker: schaefer
Dialogue: Who the hell are you...?

Speaker: hunter
Dialogue: ...You?

Speaker: pilot
Dialogue: Holy, fuck, what was that...?!!!

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: Orbit right...check it out!

Speaker: anna
Dialogue: NOOOOOO!!!!!!

Speaker: medic
Dialogue: Looks like he's been through hell...can't believe he's still alive.  What the hell went on down there?

Speaker: philips
Dialogue: If it hadn't been for her, he'd be dead now.  That story she told us...I still can't believe it.
